qas.question: How was the assassination supposed to have been carried out?
Who assumed power in Saudi Arabia after the failed assassination attempt?
What was King Faisal's position toward Nasser?

context: While Nasser was in Syria, <a0_0>King Saud<a0_0/> planned to have him assassinated on his return flight to Cairo. On 4 March, Nasser addressed the masses in Damascus and waved before them the Saudi check given to Syrian security chief and Nasser supporter Abdel Hamid Sarraj to <a1_0>shoot down Nasser's plane<a1_0/>. As a consequence of Saud's scheme, he was forced by senior members of the Saudi royal family to informally cede most of his powers to his brother, <a2_0>King Faisal<a2_0/>, a major <a3_0>opponent<a3_0/> of Nasser and advocate for pan-Islamic unity over pan-Arabism.
